_meta.description: Per-family location guidance and co-examination notes for pattern discovery agents

changes.name: Incremental Capacity
changes.note: free_clear, ratio, and builders are all about incremental capacity and should be subsumed under a new incremental L1 family. IED stays as-is (it lives in the indebtedness covenant, not the incremental section).
acquisition_debt, contribution_debt, and subordinated_debt are all baskets in the indebtedness covenant and should be children of indebtedness, not siblings.

debt_capacity.incremental.location_guidance: The incremental provision governs incremental capacity including free and clear, ratio-based, and builder mechanisms. Typically in Article II or a dedicated incremental facility section.
debt_capacity.incremental.primary_location: Incremental section (typically Article II or dedicated incremental facility section)
debt_capacity.incremental.notes: New L1 family subsuming free_clear, ratio, and builders. These all describe aspects of incremental capacity and are found in the incremental section and/or relevant incremental definitions.

debt_capacity.incremental.free_clear.location_guidance: Free and clear (aka 'freebie basket') is set in the incremental provision and/or in a relevant incremental definition.
debt_capacity.incremental.free_clear.primary_location: Incremental section (typically Article II or a dedicated incremental facility section)
debt_capacity.incremental.free_clear.notes: The incremental section should always be returned as a match. Any relevant incremental definitions must also be examined. Now a child of the new debt_capacity.incremental L1 family.

debt_capacity.incremental.ratio.location_guidance: Ratio-based capacity is set in the incremental provision and/or in a relevant incremental definition, same as free and clear capacity.
debt_capacity.incremental.ratio.notes: Same structural guidance as free_clear: incremental section should always be returned, plus relevant incremental definitions. Now a child of the new debt_capacity.incremental L1 family.

debt_capacity.incremental.builders.location_guidance: Builder mechanisms are set in the incremental provision and/or in a relevant incremental definition, same as free and clear and ratio-based capacity.
debt_capacity.incremental.builders.notes: Same structural guidance as free_clear and ratio: incremental section should always be returned, plus relevant incremental definitions. Now a child of the new debt_capacity.incremental L1 family.

debt_capacity.incremental.mfn.location_guidance: MFN protection is found in the incremental section but may also apply to other types of debt such as incremental equivalent debt.
co_examine: any other sections that include MFN protection (e.g., incremental equivalent debt provisions)
debt_capacity.incremental.mfn.notes: Broader scope than other incremental sub-families: MFN may appear in multiple locations beyond the core incremental section. Any MFN protection definitions, the incremental section, and any other sections with MFN protection should all be returned.

debt_capacity.incremental.ied.location_guidance: Incremental equivalent debt is virtually always included as a basket in the indebtedness covenant. Sometimes also covered in a corresponding defined term.
co_examine: corresponding defined terms for incremental equivalent debt
debt_capacity.incremental.ied.notes: Unlike other incremental sub-families, IED lives in the indebtedness covenant rather than the incremental section. Stays as-is (not subsumed under the new incremental L1 family).

debt_capacity.incremental.stacking_recla.location_guidance: Stacking and reclassification is always provided for in an interpretive provision in Article I. If the defined terms section is not in Article I, it will be in the same article that contains the defined terms.
debt_capacity.incremental.stacking_recla.primary_location: Interpretive provisions section in Article I (or same article as defined terms)
debt_capacity.incremental.stacking_recla.notes: Always in an interpretive provision, co-located with or adjacent to the defined terms.

debt_capacity.indebtedness.location_guidance: Indebtedness will always be a section in the negative covenants article.
debt_capacity.indebtedness.notes: Always a section in the negative covenants article. Now absorbs acquisition_debt, contribution_debt, and subordinated_debt as children (they are baskets within the indebtedness covenant).

debt_capacity.liens.location_guidance: Liens will always be a separate section dedicated to liens in the negative covenants article, usually but not always before or after the indebtedness section.
debt_capacity.liens.notes: Typically adjacent to the indebtedness section in the negative covenants article, but not always.

debt_capacity.side_by_side_revolvers.notes: Deferred to a separate devoted discussion at the end.

cash_flow.notes: Cash flow and value leakage domain-level discussion deferred to a separate devoted discussion at the end.

cash_flow.rp.location_guidance: Restricted payments will always be in the negative covenants article. There are multiple structural approaches: (1) Bond-style: RP, investments, and restricted debt payments are combined in a single section with subsections for each; (2) Regular credit agreement: RP, investments, and restricted debt payments are each separate sections in the negative covenants article; (3) Hybrid A: RP and investments are their own sections, but restricted debt payments is covered within the RP section; (4) Hybrid B: Both RP and restricted debt payments have their own separate sections.
co_examine: restricted debt payments section or subsection
structural_variants: Bond-style: combined section with subsections for RP, investments, restricted debt payments
Regular: separate sections for RP, investments, and restricted debt payments
Hybrid A: RP and investments as own sections; restricted debt payments within RP section
Hybrid B: RP and restricted debt payments each have separate sections
cash_flow.rp.notes: The relationship between RP, investments, and restricted debt payments varies significantly by deal structure. All three should be analyzed together.

cash_flow.inv.location_guidance: Investments will always be in the negative covenants article. May be a standalone section or part of a combined bond-style section with restricted payments and restricted debt payments.
cash_flow.inv.notes: See cash_flow.rp for the full set of structural variants governing how RP, investments, and restricted debt payments are organized. The children of the investments family are already carve-outs to the investments covenant (this is why the separate carve_outs family was removed).

cash_flow.restricted_debt_payments.location_guidance: Restricted debt payments will always be in the negative covenants article. May be its own section, a subsection of a combined bond-style section, or covered within the restricted payments section itself.
cash_flow.restricted_debt_payments.notes: See cash_flow.rp for the full set of structural variants. Restricted debt payments has the most variation in placement.

cash_flow.dispositions.location_guidance: Asset sales and dispositions will always have a dedicated section in the negative covenants article. Must also examine a corresponding set of definitions that are integral for analysis.
cash_flow.dispositions.notes: Critical: the definitions (Net Proceeds, Asset Sale, Disposition, and others) MUST be examined alongside the negative covenants section. The section alone is insufficient for analysis.

cash_flow.mandatory_prepayment.location_guidance: Mandatory prepayments will virtually always be in Article II, either as a separate dedicated section or as a clause within a general prepayments section (which also covers voluntary prepayments).
cash_flow.mandatory_prepayment.primary_location: Article II (prepayments section or dedicated mandatory prepayments section)
structural_variants: Standalone: dedicated mandatory prepayments section in Article II
Combined: clause within a general prepayments section alongside voluntary prepayments
cash_flow.mandatory_prepayment.notes: Similar to incrementals in that it lives in Article II. The corresponding definitions for excess cash flow and asset sales must be analyzed alongside the section/clause.

cash_flow.carve_outs.reason: Already covered by cash_flow.inv. The children of the investments family are already carve-outs to the investments covenant. Redundant family.

cash_flow.simultaneous_incurrence_nettin.notes: Deferred to a separate devoted discussion at the end.

fin_framework.ebitda.location_guidance: The EBITDA definition may appear as 'Consolidated EBITDA', 'EBITDA', or 'Last 12 Months EBITDA', but will always contain 'EBITDA' in the name. Found in the defined terms section.
co_examine: defined terms referenced within the EBITDA definition
Consolidated Net Income definition (starting place for EBITDA)
fin_framework.ebitda.notes: EBITDA should be examined alongside any defined terms inside the EBITDA definition itself, plus Consolidated Net Income which is the starting point for the EBITDA calculation.

fin_framework.leverage.location_guidance: Leverage ratios consist of separate definitions in the defined terms section.
fin_framework.leverage.notes: Multiple separate ratio definitions. Each is its own defined term.

fin_framework.financial_covenant.location_guidance: Financial covenants will either consist of their own article or be a section in the negative covenants article.
fin_framework.financial_covenant.primary_location: Own article OR section in negative covenants article
structural_variants: Standalone: own dedicated article for financial covenants
Embedded: section within the negative covenants article

fin_framework.equity_cure.location_guidance: Equity cure will either be a section towards the end of the events of default article or in the financial covenants article, but is usually at the end of the events of default article.
fin_framework.equity_cure.primary_location: Events of default article (usually at the end) OR financial covenants article
structural_variants: Typical: section at the end of the events of default article
Alternative: section in the financial covenants article
fin_framework.equity_cure.notes: Usually at the end of the events of default article.

fin_framework.lct.location_guidance: LCT (Limited Condition Transactions) is usually a definition as well as a subsection in the interpretive provisions at the end of Article I.
fin_framework.lct.primary_location: Interpretive provisions (end of Article I) and defined terms section
fin_framework.lct.notes: Dual presence: both a defined term and an interpretive provision subsection in Article I.

fin_framework.accounting.notes: Deferred to a separate devoted discussion at the end.

credit_protection.events_of_default.location_guidance: Events of default will always be its own article.

governance.pre_closing.location_guidance: Pre-closing mechanics will always be covered in the conditions precedent article.
governance.pre_closing.notes: Always in the conditions precedent article.

governance.other_advisory_roles.notes: Skipped for now per user instruction.
